title: Big Tech painted as the railroad barons of the digital age in antitrust hearing
text: For the most part — if you could tune out the political grandstanding that had nothing to do with antirust — the Congressional hearing on Big Tech gave many pointed examples of how four of the biggest tech companies in the U.S. abuse their dominant power and thwart competition.

title: NY York Rep. Jerry Nadler Blasts FB, Google For Stealing News, Destroying Journalism Jobs At Antirust Hearing
text: Disappearing journalism jobs were among the many ills laid at the feet of top tech execs Wednesday as House Judiciary Committee Chairman Jerry Nadler (D-NY) at an antitrust hearing lamented the decline of local news and recalled a massive mess up by Facebook five years ago that accelerated the contraction in the business. “These publishers

title: Congress grills tech CEOs amid backdrop of coronavirus and economic struggles
text: For more than six hours, members of the House Antitrust Subcommittee grilled the CEOs of Alphabet, Amazon, Apple and Facebook on a wide range of matters. Here's a recap.

title: Lawmakers, United in Their Ire, Lash Out at Big Tech’s Leaders
text: The chiefs of Amazon, Apple, Google and Facebook faced withering questions from Democrats about anti-competitive practices and from Republicans about anti-conservative bias.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg skewered with internal emails during antitrust hearing
text: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg stumbled at a congressional hearing on alleged abuse of market power on Wednesday, as lawmakers confronted the social media titan with damaging internal emails about the company's acquisitions.

title: Big Tech hearing a chance to 'rake the ultra-rich over the coals,' Jim Cramer says
text: "I come to praise the titans of tech, not bury them," "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer said as Big Tech chief executives testified in front of a congressional subcommittee.

title: Rep. Jerry Nadler blames Facebook, Google for demise of news industry
text: House Judiciary Committee Chairman Jerrold Nadler on Wednesday accused Google and Facebook of being responsible for the demise of journalism in the US. title: Watch Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's opening testimony to Congress
text: The CEOs from four of the largest tech companies are testifying in front of the House Judiciary subcommittee on antitrust Wednesday.

title: In antitrust hearing, Zuckerberg admits Facebook has copied its competition
text: At the House Antitrust Subcommittee hearings this afternoon, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was directly questioned about his company’s strategy of copying competitors’ app and features, and even threatening to do so as a negotiation tactic amid M&A discussions. text: CEOs from major U.S. tech companies, including Amazon.com, Inc., Apple Inc., Facebook, Inc., Alphabet, Inc., testified in Washington, D.C. -- albeit from remote locations -- in front of the House Antitrust Subcommittee.

text: The US’s top tech bosses were told they have “too much power”, are censoring political speech, spreading fake news and “killing” the engines of the American economy, at a combative Congressional hearing on Wednesday.

title: As TikTok faces a ban, its new CEO accuses Facebook of attacks ‘disguised as patriotism’
text:
CEO Kevin Mayer published an open letter blasting Facebook for allegedly trying to snuff out its competition—namely, TikTok.

title: Pandemic makes Big Tech even more powerful, warns top U.S. antitrust lawmaker

text: DA Davidson Senior Research Analyst Tom Forte discusses the Big Tech antitrust hearing on Capitol Hill. title: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook has made Instagram, WhatsApp better
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg will defend his company’s ownership of Instagram and WhatsApp to congressional lawmakers Wednesday amid calls to break up the powerful platforms. title: Big Tech to tangle with Washington lawmakers in antitrust showdown
text: The CEOs of four of America's largest tech firms will testify before U.S. Congress on Wednesday in a hearing that promises a healthy dose of political theater, while also offering a window into the thinking of lawmakers trying to rein in Big Tech.

title: Congress is about to grill the CEOs of Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google
text: For over a year, top lawmakers in Congress have been investigating Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google. The investigation's purpose? To determine whether the companies have abused their power and dominance in the online marketplace.

title: Apple, Google, Facebook and Amazon C.E.O.s Are Testifying Before Congress. Here's What to Know.

title: Facebook Offering Substantial Financial Incentives To Bring TikTok Talent On Its 'Instagram Reels' Platform
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) subsidiary Instagram has attempted to draw popular TikTok creators to its own competing short-form video service Reels by offering financial incentives, the Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday.
